review_blob: Smells of a Juicy tropical punch in the face, passionfruit and stone fruit. Sweet malt backbone but dry and bitter finish. This is a cracker.

Aroma is fruity with a tropical lime kick. Pours thick black with frothy tan head. Taste is sweet and bitter char from the rye and dark malts then the hops hit you with a juicy fruity bitter punch. Reasonably carbonated and thick mouth feel. The highish alcohol is well hidden behind the hops.
beer_name: Firestone Walker Wookey Jack Black Rye IPA

review_blob: Aroma of tangy raisins and a little burnt caramel with a hint of something a little funky. Pours thick and sludgy from the bottle with a good amount of tan foam quickly disappearing to lacing. Tastes sweet and fruity like Christmas pudding, then quickly giving way to some red wine and tannin tartness, with a hint of warm woodiness. Mouth feel is rich and thick. This is great.

Smells beautiful. Of grapefruit and passionfruit with sweet biscuit aroma. Pours dark ruby red with fine tan head. Ginger snap biscuit then the hops come bundling in quickly moderate but not overpowering bittering with a fruit salad tang. Tropical fruit and citrus finish.
Coconut aroma with caramel cherry ripe. Im having to hold myself back from quaffing this. Vanilla sweetness comes though at the end with boozy finish.
Wow. Boozy sweet after dinner liquor style beer. Like an subtlety played quad. toffee biscuits and plums.
Smells great, dark treacle and spicy resins. Beautiful oily black pour with thin tan ring around the edge of the glass. Taste is mild char with bittersweet treacle.

Smells faintly of lemon meringue and spice. Pours golden with a mild cloud of yeast particles. Fine pale foam on top. Taste is spicy and just a little sour, with the wheat notes more prominent than some other saisons. Sweet short bread crust on a lime tart. A good level of viscosity in the mouth. Great to sip, not quaff.
Drunk with stoutnick. Mild pepper aroma, with a lime zest tang. Feels good in the mouth, expect a mild pucker.
Slight char with rich velvety chocolate malt then pow, the chilli hits in the middle if the palate, followed by the bitter coffee hops combo, while the chilli lingers. Great.
beer_name: Garage Project Day Of The Dead

review_blob: Complex aroma apricots and toffee. Pours deep amber with fine white lacing. Taste is awesome, that slightly burnt bit of toffee from the bottom of the pan, fruit including white grapes, apricot, white peach. Actually like a short crust apricot pie. Feel is syrupy but not too thick, with moderate carbonation. Great beer. I had it for dessert which is the right time for this beer.
beer_name: Yeastie Boys The Sun Before the Darkness

review_blob: Smells initially of slightly bitter roasted grain, herbal hops, dark choc, and then some sharp/sweet white wine. Pours dark treacley brown, with fine creamy tan foam. Taste is deep, rich and complex worth sipping and enjoying different flavors coming to the fore as it warms. Unsweetened dark chocolate, mild licorice, treacle, bitterness from the roasted grain then further back on the palate from the hops. There is an elusive tartness that when you look for fades into middle-palate sweetness before the hops take over. Feel in the mouth is thick and syrupy, hits every part of the tongue, and lingers just long enough to enjoy. Really enjoyable beer

Pours clear light Amber with fine white cloudy head. Aroma is slightly metallic herbal grass. Tastes light fresh mostly impacting the back of the palate with a sort of leafy bitterness (but different to hops bitterness...) I drank this on a 30*c evening and it went down very quickly.

Smells of wood smoke and banana and light tobacco. Pours a dark translucent Brown with fine tan head. Tastes of smoke, molasses, savory licorice, banana, and more smoke. All this with a short sharp bitter finish. Surprisingly syrupy in the mouth feels rich and smooth. Really delicious.

Pours pretty flat but a deep dark brown/black. Aroma is slightly black coffee with a sour fruit overtone. Tastes tart like granny Smith apples and sour blackberries, finishes with a lingering sourness like a red wine. Its dry and thinner than youd expect from the colour. I couldnt really taste or smell the presence of the hops, they definitely play second fiddle to the sourness. I enjoyed this and am glad some Australians are doing good farmhouse ales (I drank the Derwent the other night but couldnt rate it at the time) but I this this beer would have come into its own on a hot afternoon rather than a mild evening
beer_name: Two Metre Tall Huon Dark Ale

review_blob: Smells of sweet tropical fruit with the underlying tang of hops. Pours cloudy tan with foamy white head dissipating quickly. Small flecks of yeast apparent. Sweet aroma quickly gives way to herbal bitterness right through the palate from start to lingering finish. Fruity yeast notes and biscuity malt lie under the piney hops. The wheat is more apparent in the aroma than flavour, but is hiding away there. As an IPA variant this is fun, if youre after a bananaery wit beer go elsewhere
beer_name: Renaissance Enlightenment Series White As Wheat IPA

review_blob: Faint whiff and taste of smoke is lovely. Good bitterness with a touch of coppery tang and bitterness at the end. Pale sparkling gold. And light and fresh mouth feel. A variation on lager well worth trying

Drank this with bbq on a warm evening outside, and this is a good context for the beer. 
Pours mildly hazy pale amber. Smells of the slightly malty sweetness of edemame and sushi rice, with a mild herbal wiff. The bottle was 6mths old though so I think the aromatic qualities were probably gone. Tastes of thin sweet Biscuit and mild hay. Finish is freshly bittering with a lingering flavor that makes you want to dive back in with another quaff. 750mls disappeared pretty quickly. Its not mind blowing. But I enjoyed it

Pours deep red with fine pink froth. Smells earthy and woody (no-one else is getting it but I smell olive and cherry pips) Im not getting strong fruit on the aroma like others but plenty of funk. Good sourness all the way through the palate and taste with the yeast the main flavor feature. Tart like unripe cherries and a little citrus (but mostly stone fruit). Hops play a subtle herbal role at the end, but the lingering sensation is puckering.

Ill admit straight up I love anything smokey - double smoked ham is only acceptable if triple is not on offer, Ill take an Islay whiskey over mainland every time, and so on. So, Im strongly inclined before I even crack this one...
Having said this I thought the smokeiness was subtlety played in both aroma and taste. Sure its there but it doesnt overwhelm. Malts are sweetish with a faint molasses flavor at the end around the back teeth (actually this will be the high alcohol), faint piney aroma under the smoke from the hops, which balances the high ABV nicely so that neither overwhelms the other. Feel in the mouth is pretty thick and smooth with low carbonation. 
I really enjoyed and am looking forward to black lung V

Aroma is great. Citrusy grand mariner fragrance. Bitter and sour together, with faint char from the malt. Pours very dark brown with tan foam head. I though it might be thicker in the mouth, but it wasnt thin...
beer_name: Mikkeller Orange Yuzu Glad I Said Porter

review_blob: UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014

Complex but subtler than I was expecting. Starts and finishes with mild tartness of the yeast and barrel, almost lemon meringue pie in lingering flavor. Malt rides through the middle sweet and light. No alcohol burn considering the high ABV but the smell is boozy. Great beer, looking forward to the next edition

Bottle from purvis. Straight up the aroma is sweet. Banana and bubblegum (as the label says) and sweet blackberry or currents too. Smells great like a good tawny port. Pours very dark reddy brown with thin lace of bubbles around the glass. Feels thick almost as viscous as a liquor with quite a deal of warmth at the back of the mouth from the high alcohol (around the tonsils). Tastes of black currents, raisins, and pastry - like a mince pie or Christmas pudding. Really enjoyed it
Bitterer than I was expecting, you can taste the good But a lot of the bitterness seems to come from the roast of the grains. Oatmeal balances it all and rounds it out well

My two favorite drinks combined. Love the bergamot aroma. Pours a dark amber with thin white head. Tropical fruit at the front of the palate giving way to the tea/hop bitterness which has a moderately long finish. Id imagine this would be quite dangerous on a hot night

Can. Artwork is great. Pours charcoal with thick dark tan froth on top. Smells of faintly burnt molassas: a little sweet, a little bitter. Taste mildly smokey in the malt, not too sweet or bitter, a dark beer you could easily have a session on.

This beer is dominated by the yeast and hops. The malt makes its presence felt in the aroma as you tip the glass towards you, grainy and fresh smelling, but as soon as it hits the palate its sour grapefruit or green grapes. But the sourness also moves very quickly to long lasting resinous hop bitterness under the influence of the galaxy and Stella hops. Pours a slightly cloudy tan colour with thick foamy head. Great beer.
Herbal hoppy aroma, pours dark copper like an old 2c piece. Syrupy feel and taste, with Anzac biscuits and slight woody flavor that gives way to moderate bitterness. All up a nice little drop

Smells of citrus and lavender but not in an overpowering way. Pours pale gold. The malt is clear and present at the front of the palate moving to grapefruit sourness. Some savory herbal notes sit under this to finish off.

Bottle from Purvis. Aroma of herbs and resin. Pours a striking orange with good white foam. Taste biscuity, grains were very apparent - I almost expected to feel then in my mouth, before the herbal resin of the hops took over. Just the right bitterness. Very sessionable, certainly not simple, but not so complex that You dont want to quaff in quantity.

Bottle from Purvis cellars. Smells of sweet/savory pipe tobacco and soft leather. Pours black like onyx with thin tan foam on top. Tastes of bitter coffee and dark chocolate with a hint of rum & raisin. Mouthfeel is smooth and lightly carbonated. Hides the high alcohol well, dangerously drinkable

There was a slight sulphur aroma when I cracked this one which was a little off putting. Taste was well rounded between a little sour yeastie notes, pale almost sweet malts, and a freshness from the hops

Green is the best word for this beer. Smells like fresh hops as soond you crack it. Mild pine, less citrus but a hint. Pours clear amber with foamy white head. Taste is almost all hops but in a balanced and complex way without riding roughshod over ones palate. Finishes relatively quickly given the bitterness, but fresh.
beer_name: Bridge Road The Harvest Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Purvis. Aroma coffee and chocolate with a hint of cherry cough syrup. Mouthfeel is also syrupy but not as thick as I was anticipating. Bitterness and sweetness march hand in hand right through the mouthful. Taste is sweet coffee. I shared this bottle and now wish I had the full .25l (haha)
beer_name: Ngne  / Mikkeller / Brewdog Horizon Tokyo Black

review_blob: A tidy and balanced number. Draft about of hop bitterness and aroma without overpowering the not too sweet malts

Bottle, from the Purvis cellars. The Cognac barrel (and the high ABV) makes its presence known immediately on the nose and follows through with a rich high flavour in the mouth. Pours deep amber with light white head. Malt backbone is sweet but not overly so letting the cognac and a little sourness shine through, there is tartness like blackberries, malts have a pastry or croissant character. The feel in the mouth is full but not a syrupy as I was expecting, but rolls nicely through the centre of the tongue. Finishes fairly dry with a touch of timber.
beer_name: Ngne  / Bridge Road Aurora Borealis II

review_blob:
The hop bitterness is just right, a little spicey mixed with resin. The finish is just long enough to enjoy without overpowering any food you are eating. Aroma is freshly crushed herbs and where the malt is most noticeable. 
Great with chilli con carne or olive and cheese. Mouth felt clean but not too dry afterward.
beer_name: Bridge Road Single Hop IPA: Galaxy

review_blob: Slightly fruity aroma, golden colour, finish slightly bitter and spicy. Well balanced and sessionable
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2012
